description: Mother X is a diverse group of artists, makers & creators that have inhabited a former Victorian chocolate factory in Hackney Wick for 15+ years. Come visit this unique building & see it's people & their work during the Open House Festival.

factsheet.heading: Open Studios
paragraphs: The artists of Mother X (in Pearl & Coutts studios), have had a home in Hackney Wick's former chocolate factory for over fifteen years.
Our London Open Houses Festival Open Studios event will see twenty-plus artists opening studio doors and showing our work in a relaxed, studio setting.
We are a diverse and international group of artists, makers, designers and creatives with work on show that will include:

- Painting and Drawing
- Sculpture
- Design
- Furniture
- Conceptual Art
- Jewellery
- Ceramics...
Artists will be available to chat, and work will be available for sale.
Please come and meet the artists in one of London's most dynamic, iconic and ever-changing creative hubs.
Your support will ensure our continued visibility and survival in a landscape under huge pressure from gentrification.

It will be a great chance to experience art in an intimate setting within an amazing listed building, and to explore the real Hackney Wick itself - a buzzing microcosm of not just artists but performers, musicians, creatives and now some of the best bars and food London has to offer. Come see our world!

location.address: Floor D and E, 9B Queens Yard, Hackney Wick

name: Mother X Artists and Makers Open Studios
